page.title: 09MINING
page.content: The history of the area is dominated by mining. Tin mining dates back to Roman times and the Wheal Vor area contained some of the most productive tin and copper mines in Cornwall. Production reached its peak at the beginning of the 19th century but by the beginning of the 20th century all the mines were closed. It is difficult to imagine this peaceful rural area was once an industrial heartland but the Wheal Vor Valley was one of the most heavily industrialised parts of England in its heyday. There is a mass of industrial archaeology to be studied in the area. Individual mines can still be identified and the methods of their operation can be understood from their ruins. The landscape is dotted with shafts and ruined engine houses.
